variant.p: Under the Framework, and IASs 32 and 39, an equity instrument is defined as any contract that evidences a residual interest in the assets of an entity after deducting all of its liabilities . Paragraph 67 of the Framework further states that the amount at which equity is recognised in the balance sheet is dependent on the measurement of assets and liabilities.
